title: Project Manager Senior (Intel)
name: Juan Rodriguez
description: Served as a Senior Operational Specialist (Operation Squadron), Asymmetric Warfare Group (AWG), advising and training units on tactics, techniques, and procedures for asymmetric warfare. As a member of a mixed active duty military and contractor team performing tasks directly related to the Global War on Terrorism. Conducted numerous patrols in Afghanistan advising Human Terrain and Human Intelligence Teams to facilitate a comprehensive collection plan to map, influence, and effect threat networks. Conducted Level II Vulnerability Assessments (L2VA) in CENTCOM AOR, advised counter intelligence cells to develop a Human Terrain Map to observe indicators that may indicate a threat to Tiered Assets. He advises and trains Brigade Combat Teams, coordinating unit technical support and providing expertise on guerilla warfare, insurgency, and operating/preparing to operate in an asymmetric environment. He previously served as Operational Specialist (Forward Support), operating a forward command post in an overseas duty environment in direct support of deployed operational elements in a tactical environment. He operated a mission support site, logistical operations, and long-range communication to ensure communication between operational elements and continental United States headquarters elements. Planned and assisted in Information Operations and assisted the operations cell.

title: Cavalry Scout
headquarters:
200 Stovall St.

Alexandria,
VA
22332
United States
address: 200 Stovall St.  Alexandria, VA 22332 United States
name: Juan Rodriguez
description: Served over 20 years in the U.S. Army with deployments to Operation Iraqi Freedom (three times), Just Cause, and Desert Storm in mounted and dismounted combat operations. He has extensive experience in Reconnaissance and Surveillance units, employing sensitive equipment - weapons and tactical optics, ammunition, sensors, tactical communications and electronic countermeasures. Processed operations and intelligence information (human and signals - HUMINT and SIGINT) and directed, supervised and trained scout, cavalry platoon and staff sections. As a senior instructor at the Armor School, he instructed Initial Entry Training personnel on live fire and movement techniques, executed and evaluated Counter-IED training lanes. As a Platoon Sergeant, he participated in combat patrols in Iraq during Counter-IED and IEDD (IED-Defeat) missions. Coordinating with Special Forces ODA during OIF III, he trained 30 personnel in basic demolitions and 4 in operations of the RAVEN unmanned aerial reconnaissance vehicle. He supervised a Battalion Operations Center and collected, interpreted, analyzed, and distributed intelligence information. He supervised an Iraqi division during hazardous conditions and designed, implemented, and improved security training for the new Iraqi Army Basic Training.
